intro: [WRONG START] Hieracium medschedense subsp. chlorophilum, commonly known as the greenleaf hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and leafy stems. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, exhibiting a low-growing habit with basal leaves. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in dense, flat clusters. The species is notable for its chlorophyll-rich leaves, which contribute to its common name and its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor environments.
